doc.field: The Fortnight Journal was an online journal made up on videos, writings, music, podcasts, and images created by the subjects of Fortnight, as well as short documentaries and biographies on members of the Millennial generation (people born from 1978-1990). The website was active from 2010-2012 and produced 4 editions from 14 contributors.

The Fortnight Journal was an online journal made up on videos, writings, music, podcasts, and images created by the subjects of Fortnight, as well as short documentaries and biographies on members of the Millennial generation (people born from 1978-1990). The website was active from 2010-2012 and produced 4 editions from 14 contributors.

The Fortnight Journal was an online journal made up on videos, writings, music, podcasts, and images created by the subjects of Fortnight, as well as short documentaries and biographies on the subjects. Fortnight focused on individuals from the Millennial generation, people born from 1978-1990. The website spotlights the contributions of 56 indivduals as well as essays by "luminary mentors" responding to the work of a member of the cohort. Mentors included Andr√©s Duany, Marian Bantjes, Noah Shachtman, Patti Smith, Johnny Thompson, Eric Shiner, Lucia Rijker, and Max Cleland. Professions represented in the documentary include writers, athletes, musicians, artists, photographers, journalists, lawyers, entrepeneurs, activists, military personnel, engineers, performers, designers, chefs, scientists, historians, teachers, and others. The physical materials in the collection consist of production material from oral history videos.

Fortnight Journal was a project created by Samantha Hinds and Adam Whitney Nichols in 2010 to document individuals from the Millennial generation, people born from 1978-1990. Fortnight Journal was a publication of Fourteen Foundation Inc, a nonprofit "devoted to reviving cross-generational mentorship by documenting and sustaining dialogue on traditional forms of practice." The The website was active from 2010-2012 and produced 4 editions from 14 contributors. Each contribution consisted of work produced by the subject as well as a short documentary on the individual.
Donated by A Thing Apart/Adam Whitney Nichols in 2014. The accession number associated with this collection is 2014.415.

In 2015, http://fortnightjournal.com/ was initially selected by curators and captured through the use of Archive-It. Archive-It uses web crawling technology to capture websites at a scheduled time and displays only an archived copy, from the resulting WARC file, of the website. There is no accession number associated with this website. In January 2023, https://soundcloud.com/fortnightjournal/ and https://vimeo.com/fortnightjournal/ were added. The accession number associated with these websites is 2023.026.

Archived websites are made accessible for purposes of education and research. NYU Libraries have given attribution to rights holders when possible; however, due to the nature of archival collections, we are not always able to identify this information.
If you hold the rights to materials in our archived websites that are unattributed, please let us know so that we may maintain accurate information about these materials.

If you are a rights holder and are concerned that you have found material on this website for which you have not granted permission (or is not covered by a copyright exception under US copyright laws), you may request the removal of the material from our site by submitting a notice, with the elements described below, to the special.collections@nyu.edu.

Please include the following in your notice: Identification of the material that you believe to be infringing and information sufficient to permit us to locate the material; your contact information, such as an address, telephone number, and email address; a statement that you are the owner, or authorized to act on behalf of the owner, of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed and that you have a good-faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agent, or the law; a statement that the information in the notification is accurate and made under penalty of perjury; and your physical or electronic signature. Upon receiving a notice that includes the details listed above, we will remove the allegedly infringing material from public view while we assess the issues identified in your notice.

Advance notice is required for the use of computer records. Original physical digital media is restricted. Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact Fales Library, special.collections@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596 with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
